result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 3rd Offense and Operating w/ PAC 3rd Offense. The defendant was found guilty of OWI 3rd Offense and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC 3rd Offense was dismissed by the court.

  • Brandon M. Hedlund was found guilty of OWI 3rd Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

126 days stayed pending successful completion of the JRI program.

Huber and electronic monitoring granted if available.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon M. Hedlund

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant along with driver's safety plan information.

10:22 AM cases 22CM5, 21TR9429, 21TR9431, 21TR9432, 21TR9433 called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon M. Hedlund in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to attorney and wishes to proceed today. State notes the defendant has been accepts into JRI program. 

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant is advised of right to a jury trial and waives this right. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: OWI 3rd Offense. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders:
$1,744 fine + Sacred Heart blood draw fee
140 days jail: 126 days stayed pending successful completion of the JRI program. Huber or Electronic Monitoring granted if available. 
50 Hours of Community Service
25 month driver's license revocation
18 month ignition interlock device
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in including  21TR9429, 21TR9431, 21TR9432, 21TR9433.
Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on February 15, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:

Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia.
